Cell.Data: The DEV TEAM / MISC NOTES column contains info on what text between { } signs means (if applicable). It usually stands for either a numeric value, or a numeric value with an icon. Text between [ ] signs stands for a certain type of icon.

Note that all the texts in this document that refer to two people - the speaker and the one spoken too - that can both be male or female.
Note that use of the 'localized' and 'alternative localized string' only applies for the gender of the speaker.
If the gender of the person spoken to requires inflection, please try to translate the text in a way that doesn't require such inflection. If this is impossible, please get in touch with us informing us of which lines this concerns and how they would be inflected in the language you are translating too.
We know your kind, criminal scum, and we’re not taking any chances with you. State your purpose and destination before we blow a brand new hole in your torso.

This text refers to a person that can either be male or female. If relevant for translation, please use the ‘localized string’ column for the male text and the ‘alternative localized string’ column for the female text.
{STR_leaderName}, you’ve got a snowball’s chance in hell to convince me you’re nothing but a lowlife. But the Vanguard is all about second chances. How would you like to use yours?

This text refers to a person that can either be male or female. If relevant for translation, please use the ‘localized string’ column for the male text and the ‘alternative localized string’ column for the female text.
The Vanguard was created to suppress threats just like you. The Star Union’s greatness may have faded, but we fight for its hope and ideals. Crossing us just puts you in the line of fire. Be careful.

This text refers to a person that can either be male or female. If relevant for translation, please use the ‘localized string’ column for the male text and the ‘alternative localized string’ column for the female text.
{STR_leaderName}, is it? What can we do for you? Make it snappy, if you don’t mind. We’ve got afternoon drills in sixteen minutes.

This text refers to a person that can either be male or female. If relevant for translation, please use the ‘localized string’ column for the male text and the ‘alternative localized string’ column for the female text.
Greetings, stranger. You’ve found the Vanguard vox-com channel. Note that this link is being traced, so no funny business. So, who are you? And what have you come here to do?

This text refers to a person that can either be male or female. If relevant for translation, please use the ‘localized string’ column for the male text and the ‘alternative localized string’ column for the female text.

Hello there, {STR_leaderName}. I represent the Vanguard in diplomatic matters, so we can talk politics if necessary. We may not be the Star Union, but we’re the closest you’ll get to that level of stability.

This text refers to a person that can either be male or female. If relevant for translation, please use the ‘localized string’ column for the male text and the ‘alternative localized string’ column for the female text.
Good day, commander {STR_leaderName}. To what do we owe the pleasure? We’d be happy to give you some pointers if you’re drawing up battle plans. The Vanguard always stands ready.

This text refers to a person that can either be male or female. If relevant for translation, please use the ‘localized string’ column for the male text and the ‘alternative localized string’ column for the female text.
Good to meet you, general. From the vid-snaps I’ve seen, you run a tight ship over there. The Vanguard could use an ally like you. Can’t rebuild an empire alone, eh?

This text refers to a person that can either be male or female. If relevant for translation, please use the ‘localized string’ column for the male text and the ‘alternative localized string’ column for the female text.
Hail, commander. I’ll warn you now, my guys and girls are not the most patient types, and neither am I, so let’s make this snappy. Unless you want to test the limits of said patience?

This text refers to a person that can either be male or female. If relevant for translation, please use the ‘localized string’ column for the male text and the ‘alternative localized string’ column for the female text.
Good morning, general. You speak with the Vanguard legion. We’ve been asleep for too long, and we’re ready to become players on the galactic stage again. Let’s begin the discussion.

This text refers to a person that can either be male or female. If relevant for translation, please use the ‘localized string’ column for the male text and the ‘alternative localized string’ column for the female text.
I’ve been authorized to extend the terms of a trade deal to you. What do you think of this?

This text refers to a person that can either be male or female. If relevant for translation, please use the ‘localized string’ column for the male text and the ‘alternative localized string’ column for the female text.
10-4, trade request received. My quartermaster has been notified.

This text refers to a person that can either be male or female. If relevant for translation, please use the ‘localized string’ column for the male text and the ‘alternative localized string’ column for the female text.

I am required by galactic law to notify you of our declaration of war upon you and your people. {STR_reasons}. This is in order to give you ample time to mobilize your forces. Not that that will do any good.

{STR_reasons} is a list of reasons, written like "You trespassed" and can be found in this excel sheet. This text refers to a person that can either be male or female. If relevant for translation, please use the ‘localized string’ column for the male text and the ‘alternative localized string’ column for the female text.
That’s it! I’ve had it up to here with you. {STR_reasons}. I’m coming over there to root you out of your hole. Get ready to die, you flaming hog-monkey!

{STR_reasons} is a list of reasons, written like "You trespassed" and can be found in this excel sheet. This text refers to a person that can either be male or female. If relevant for translation, please use the ‘localized string’ column for the male text and the ‘alternative localized string’ column for the female text.
Poor discipline. Failing composure. Lack of a spine. All traits of a first-week recruit about to wash out of the academy. And you, of course.

This text refers to a person that can either be male or female. If relevant for translation, please use the ‘localized string’ column for the male text and the ‘alternative localized string’ column for the female text.
That the Star Union ever birthed your failure of a society is a black mark that I hope to be able to erase one day. Watch your back, trash.

This text refers to a person that can either be male or female. If relevant for translation, please use the ‘localized string’ column for the male text and the ‘alternative localized string’ column for the female text.
What is your major malfunction, soldier?! The crud on my dog’s paws would make a more competent leader than you! If I were you, I’d have shot myself into the sun years ago!

This text refers to a person that can either be male or female. If relevant for translation, please use the ‘localized string’ column for the male text and the ‘alternative localized string’ column for the female text.
I salute you, commander {STR_leaderName}. You have led your population to success and prosperity, embodying the very ideals that the Star Union originally strived towards. Keep up the good work!

This text refers to a person that can either be male or female. If relevant for translation, please use the ‘localized string’ column for the male text and the ‘alternative localized string’ column for the female text.
Well now, I’m not one for compliments, but I have to hand it to you. You’ve really got all your ducks in a row over there. Hell, even my quartermasters are envious of your organization!

This text refers to a person that can either be male or female. If relevant for translation, please use the ‘localized string’ column for the male text and the ‘alternative localized string’ column for the female text.
Now there is a proud and respectable commander worthy of praise! I’m gonna take some lessons from your leadership style to sharpen my own program. Thanks for the inspiration!

This text refers to a person that can either be male or female. If relevant for translation, please use the ‘localized string’ column for the male text and the ‘alternative localized string’ column for the female text.
Affirmative on the deal. Proceed to the designated offloading strip.

This text refers to a person that can either be male or female. If relevant for translation, please use the ‘localized string’ column for the male text and the ‘alternative localized string’ column for the female text.
Just get on with the exchange already. I don’t have the luxury of wasting time chit-chatting with you.

This text refers to a person that can either be male or female. If relevant for translation, please use the ‘localized string’ column for the male text and the ‘alternative localized string’ column for the female text.
That’s a negatory! You’ll have to do better than that, friend.

This text refers to a person that can either be male or female. If relevant for translation, please use the ‘localized string’ column for the male text and the ‘alternative localized string’ column for the female text.
That’s a terrible deal. You should be ashamed to even offer that. Try again, cupcake!

This text refers to a person that can either be male or female. If relevant for translation, please use the ‘localized string’ column for the male text and the ‘alternative localized string’ column for the female text.
